In This Issue
Welcome to the first customer newsletter under our TriTech Software Systems name. We want to keep you, our valued customers, well informed of product and service announcements, company information, technical tips and key industry information through vehicles like this customer newsletter. Over the last six months we have assembled the leading public safety software providers together with one single focus. That effort has unified the best people and products in the industry today, resulting in the most trusted and innovative enterprise-wide solutions in 911 Dispatch, Law, Fire and EMS.
Many of the names and faces at TriTech will already be familiar as the company continues to operate from existing office locations in Castle Hayne, NC; North Grafton, MA; Denver, CO; Decorah, IA; and San Diego, CA – but under a single structure, team and company. With the rich collection of knowledge brought into a single public safety software solution – developed, sold and supported under one company – TriTech is able to offer a complete, integrated, end-to-end enterprise-wide solution from a single company that’s large enough to withstand economic swings, but not so large that customers don’t get the attention they deserve.
Thank you for the opportunity to serve as your public safety software business partner.
Mike Lyons, VP of Operations TriTech Software Systems
-----
VisionRMS, VisionJAIL and VisionFBR The new 4.4 releases of RMS, JAIL and FBR are right around the corner. The Limited Availability test site just completed their testing and the teams are gearing up to incorporate the test findings and put the finishing touches on the Generally Available (GA) release. With 4.4, users will benefit from several new features alongside the resolution of many client-reported issues. [READ MORE] <http://offers.tritech.com/TriTechNews_Q1_2012_NC_Products.html>
-----
VisionCAD and VisionMOBILE The VisionCAD 3.7 and VisionMOBILE 3.7 releases are also quickly approaching the Limited Availability test phase with a client partner. These releases of CAD and MOBILE join together to allow dispatch and field operations to attach and view all media associated to a call. CAD users will also benefit from the added flexibility of exporting data directly from the grids in VisionCAD to Microsoft Excel. [LEARN MORE] <http://offers.tritech.com/TriTechNews_Q1_2012_NC_Products.html>

INFORM 5.0 We are excited to announce that the new VisionINFORM 5.0 product was released for field trial in early March. As the initial development concluded, we began to work with a client in North Carolina who is helping test the capabilities of the powerful search index, web query and dashboard components. [READ MORE] <http://offers.tritech.com/TriTechNews_Q1_2012_NC_Products.html>

Employee Spotlight: Charles "Chuck" Leonard, Client Services Team Lead Charles (Chuck) Leonard has served VisionAIR software customers for over 12 years. In his current position as Client Services Team Lead, Chuck helps support team members with case handling, issues that escalate to engineering, divvying out the workload, and mentoring new support employees who join the team – in addition to answerind technical calls on the products. Chuck has served in many areas of the training and support team, including working as a Client Service Technician, a CAD/Mobile/Fire software trainer on the implementation team and in his current position where he also answers the 24/7/365 Mobile pager during non-office hours. [FIND OUT MORE ABOUT CHUCK] <http://offers.tritech.com/TriTechNews_Q1_2012_NC_Support.html>

National Telecommunicator's Week
As we celebrate National Telecommunicator’s Week, we reflect on the importance of the contributions our 911 dispatchers provide to the community. Each day, thousands of individuals dial 911 for various emergencies, ranging from violent crime to car accidents to life-threatening medical emergencies. Each day thousands of people depend on your skill, expertise, understanding, and commitment to public service to guide them through their most difficult moments.
